preamble.P:
You have reached the logically existing, virtual ACE+TAO+CIAO scoreboard. It shows all the OS/compiler combinations ACE+TAO+CIAO are tested against everyday, all over the world. We have builds running continuously at ISIS, Vanderbilt University, Remedy IT, Riverace Corporation, PrismTech, Object Computing Inc, Qualcomm, John Zorko, J.T. Conklin.
The distributed scoreboard is divided into following categories:
ACE/TAO/CIAO builds for release with test statistics integrated
ACE Builds for Beta/Release [regular|detailed|rss]
ACE Builds for Future Beta/Release [regular|detailed]
TAO Builds for Beta/Release [regular|detailed|rss]
TAO Builds for Future Beta/Release [regular|detailed]
CIAO Builds for Beta/Release [regular|detailed|rss]
DDS Builds for Beta/Release [regular|rss]
CoSMIC Builds for Beta/Release [regular]
Miscellaneous Builds
Integrated page having all the above in a single page for folks who like it!
Skoll -- Distributed Continuous Quality Assurance
If you'd like to contribute builds to our virtual scoreboard please contact us and let us know which platform combinations you can contribute. Instructions for setting up your own daily build and scoreboard are available here.
We use the daily builds as a basis to collect important metrics like compilation time, footprint and performance details. Please refer to this page for more details.
Additional Development Process Related Pages
In addition to the build results found in the Scoreboard described above, a number of other ACE/TAO/CIAO development process related web pages we use are the following:
Code Coverage
Compile- and Run-Time Statistics
Text based test statistics
Footprint statistics with GCC 4.0.2
Footprint statistics with GCC 4.0.2 on FC4:
Regular,
CORBA e/compact,
CORBA e/micro
The Code Coverage pages illustrate which areas of ACE+TAO+CIAO code are used, and how frequently. The Compile- and Run-Time pages contain compilation times, static footprint measurements, and performance metrics.
